qas.question: When was the Assumption dogmatically define by the Catholic Church?
In which papal document was the dogma of the Assumption defined?
Other than the Roman Catholic Church, which church holds the doctrine of the Assumption to be true?
What is another name for the Assumption of Mary?
What year did Pope Pius XII join The Roman Catholic Church?
In what year did Mary die?
Which Eastern Church did Pope Pius XII visit in 1950?

context: The doctrines of the Assumption or <a4_0>Dormition<a4_0/> of Mary relate to her death and bodily assumption to Heaven. The Roman Catholic Church has dogmaically defined the doctrine of the Assumption, which was done in <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>1950<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> by <a2_0><b8_0>Pope Pius XII<b8_0/><a2_0/> in <a1_0>Munificentissimus Deus<a1_0/>. Whether the Virgin Mary died or not is not defined dogmatically, however, although a reference to the death of Mary are made in Munificentissimus Deus. In <b7_0>the <a3_0>Eastern Orthodox Church<b7_0/><a3_0/>, the Assumption of the Virgin Mary is believed, and celebrated with her Dormition, where they believe she died.
